page.title: 04SHOPPING FACILITIES
page.content: The shops are mainly small but supply a wide range of food and general household goods in daily need. There is a Co-operative Store at the corner of Duke Street and Duddon Road. It is by far the largest shop in the area. There are several "corner shops" in the housing areas but most of the shopping facilities are concentrated along Duke Street. They are adequate for the day to day shopping needs of the local residents although there may be problems of restricted choice for some items. Other shopping needs must be satisfied in the nearby towns of Barrow,Ulverston and Dalton, this involves the added cost of travelling. It follows that a small population can only support a shop that sells goods in general and regular consumption, such as bread and other foodstuffs.
